conclusion: Plan to solve for output power when power source is connected to resistor.
Line I represents terminal voltage vs. current for power source; Line II represents volt-ampere characteristic of resistor R; Intersection point is the operating point.
Intersection point coordinates are approximately Current (I) = 2 A and Voltage (U) = 2 V.
Calculate output power using P = U × I; Substituting values gives P = 2 V × 2 A = 4 W.
Verification: Line I shows terminal voltage decreases as current increases; Line II shows linear relationship (Ohm's Law); Intersection point satisfies both constraints.
Final answer: Output power of power source when connected to resistor R is 4 watts.
